website_summaries.verdict: With an ergonomic handle and a modern look, this starter’s powerfully hot airstream ignites charcoal in approximately 60 seconds.
pros: Quality construction with extra-long base and sturdy handle
Blow-torch style operation makes it one of the fastest starters
cons: Some reports of aluminum cover melting off
Lighting mechanism stops working within a year for some
Must hold down button entire time

customer_reviews.title: Company will not respond to safety issue!
customer_reviews.text: Had about a year now and the aluminum cover has melted off. I have contacted Looflighter via website to ask for replacement cover and no reply. This is a safety issue as the element is exposed without protection.
customer_reviews.author: Boots918

customer_reviews.title: I regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I regret this purchase. It did not even make it two years. I followed the directions to the letter, but as you can see in the attached photos, the tip has melted. I was using mine in a Big Green Egg and would very carefully touch it to the unlit coals, as instructed, and then pull it away when sparks begin to fly. Apart from not lasting two years, it throws out way too much smoke, soot, and sparks as it lights your wood and coals.
customer_reviews.author: Unfrozen Caveman Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: so a friend of mine recommended this to me as he received one as a ...
customer_reviews.text: OK, so a friend of mine recommended this to me as he received one as a gift. It works wonderfully but you have to realize that instead of lighting your charcoal in a chimney and walking away, you're going to stand around with smoke wafting in your face while you even out the coals. BUT the extra 5-10 minutes you spend doing this will ignite all your charcoal evenly and you will see an extra 30-50% burn time! Less worry about temperature dropping and fewer briquette re-loads. If you have the extra money and an electrical outlet handy this may be for you.
customer_reviews.author: FLGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great little fire starter.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a charcoal grill this is extremely worth it. I hate to use any charcoal that had lighter fluid already impregnated in it. I like to use lump charcoal, wood charcoal or organic charcoal. The lighter gets the charcoal going very quickly. Usually I had to put lots of lighter fluid on the charcoal to get it going and then saturate it again. This way I hold it to the charcoal for a few minutes in one spot and that charcoal is ready to go. I then get another section of charcoal going the same way. After about 5 minutes the grill is ready and hot.
customer_reviews.author: Durham

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing device. I have rediscovered the "charcoal cooking" pleasure ...
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing device. I have rediscovered the "charcoal cooking" pleasure with this piece of equipment. I left charcoal grilling because of the difficulty in using charcoal, like length of time to get the fire to cooking temperature and the awful smell of using either lighter fuel or fuel infused charcoal. I used the lighter tool for the first time last night and was amazed at how quickly the charcoal got to cooking temperature. 5 minutes, can you believe that? Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - Melted after a year
customer_reviews.text: This item worked very well for about a year and then the aluminum? shielding around the heating element just melted. At this price point I'm extremely dissatisfied with this product's quality.
customer_reviews.author: alexandkelly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have a long life expectancy
customer_reviews.text: Worked about 20 minutes total, used to light maybe 5 fires. Aluminum heat guard melts/deforms really easy, and the heat output dropped significantly over the month I had it. Save money and get the 1500w heat gun from harbor freight. It's a little heftier, but works much better and seems to actually reach the advertised 1100*F
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after first try
customer_reviews.text: Well its a 110 volt product nowhere does it warn you, that it will fry everything inside if you use 220 volts and 220 is the world norm, worst part is i can just swap the motor in this case the "smart" design is not so smart after all if you want to reach any component the whole device needs to be scrapped its riveted on all sides you need to break the product to access the components i was so disappointed broke my dads heart :(
customer_reviews.author: Abdulfattah

customer_reviews.title: This works much better than the starter cubes that came with my big ...
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than the starter cubes that came with my big green egg. This allows me to light the charcoal more evenly and quicker... but it does require more manual effort. Also, you need a plug nearby and won't be able to use it if it's raining. I've only used this once, but so far it's an improvement. I chose this over the chimney since I use lump and I hear you can't fit much lump in a chimney.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I liked this lighter but it's overpriced I grill a lot. I'd say an average of 3 nights a week. This worked for about 3 years before it crapped out. I'd heard stories about the cheaper ones burning up so I spent the extra money on this. The problem is (if you grill frequently and will be putting more wear on yours), some of the cheap ones also have 2 year warranties so there's no real point in spending the extra money. Cheaper models also offer a blower only mode which would be nice. Also having to hold the button down can be annoying, but I could see how it can be explained as a "safety feature."
customer_reviews.author: cableguy

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for 5 months. It no longer works at all. Does not turn on or get hot. Completely dead. It worked well initially but for $70 I expect it to last. I have used it properly and stored it inside. Very, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ppmomma

customer_reviews.title: A must have for Eggheads.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using BGE Fire Starters and it takes about 30 mins to get the fire ready for cooking. Looftlighter cuts that time by 2/3. Its quick and safe to light the charcoal. I do not have a electrical outlet near by so need to use a extension cable every time I need to use Looftlighter, it is small inconvenience compared to time saved.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: A Great product
customer_reviews.text: This lighter does exactly what its supposed to do. Of course if you expect it to light up your lump coal in an instant, then you will be disappointed. It blows heated air. That air ignites the coal, so of course it will take some time. It doesn't work like a light switch that you the moment you turn it down, the bulb will light up. Generally speaking, it will take about half a minute before you see the sparking coal ( depends on the lump coal you use. I use the Jealous Devil) . When i received it, the Aluminum was dented. I could have returned it, but instead I straightened it out and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Umar

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: This worked fantastically for four cycles. On the fifth use, it would not operate when the button was depressed. I looked more carefully at the devise and the sturdy looking aluminum shroud was loose and fell off. The aluminum around the set screws was less than 1mm thick and the shroud fell off due to metal fatigue. The wiring and internal solder joints looked like they were put together by an uncaring child. I am back with my reliable propane torch.
customer_reviews.author: notans

customer_reviews.title: This starter is really a great thing to have
customer_reviews.text: This starter is really a great thing to have. I bbq about 2-3 times a week and use it nearly every time. Unfortunately, today is the day it stopped working. The motor just up and died. I can smell the mechanical fumes. Whats really unfortunate is that this happened exactly 45 days outside of my 2 year warranty window. I'm sure my suspicion is incorrect, but it would be a real bummer to learn this thing goes from working to dying a short window after the hardware warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Very quick and easy...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect way to start a fire quickly w/o petroleum-based starters. A friend introduced to me the Looftlighter and it's an awesome way to start lump charcoal in 2-3 minutes without effort. While it has a protective shield, it does get quite hot, so be careful where it sit immediately after use. Suggest metal or ceramic so as not to burn or melt skin, plastic, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Crusty

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed; we followed the directions exactly and watched the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed; we followed the directions exactly and watched the videos. Even after holding the starter near the coals for extended time and pulling back, the embers action was minimal. It definitely did not perform as well as it did in the videos. Sorry to say because I really wanted it to work.
customer_reviews.author: MAW

customer_reviews.title: Great charcoal starter
customer_reviews.text: I had used matches and cubes to start my Green Egg and it took forever (over 1 hour) to get the temperature up to the desired level.This got the Green Egg up to the desired level in a few minutes (10 minutes or less). I have only used it once so I can not comment on its longevity. It is quite safe although I used safety googles to protect my eyes from the initial sparks just in case but they never really got close to me.
customer_reviews.author: TOBG

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first!
customer_reviews.text: But it no longer works! Used it for one cook-out season, probably 6-8 times. Now it won't work! Burned out from inside. Great idea, needs Mr. Dyson to improve on the design!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Winner

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Great Company!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES his Looftlighter. He can start the coals on his Big Green Egg without any fuel. Unfortunately, it stopped working last weekend. I wrote to the company and the owner replied, asking for the serial number, the receipt (my Amazon confirmation) and a photo. He replaced it free of charge!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee R.

customer_reviews.title: unreliable and over priced
customer_reviews.text: worked well 30-40 times then just died. No power with a smell of burnt plastic. I called the company and was on hold forever. when i finally got thru i was told bc my unit is 4 mos out of warranty i had no recourse. for the price clearly should be a more reliable unit. i would not recomend
customer_reviews.author: Mark J Palmucci

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Charcoal is lit within seconds
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Charcoal is lit within seconds, just remember you still need to let the coals burn down for at least a good 10-15 min after lighting. Love the heavy duty feel of it, and it cools down very fast after using so I can put it away pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Worked great...then just stopped working! :(
customer_reviews.text: Wow, really disappointed in this unit. Was working great for lighting my lump charcoal and then just absolutely stopped functioning after just 5-6 short months. I've taken real good care of this so definitely was not from misuse or abuse.
customer_reviews.author: arizonawildcat

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I used the loof lighter just once. I was lighting lump charcoal and after one minute it began to spark. After another minute I let the looflighter blow and get the coals going. Moving to the other side of the stack I repeated the process. Twelve minutes later I had a great bed of coals and let the grate and the kamodo come to temperature. I highly recommend this over the chimney and newspaper that I was using
customer_reviews.author: jorkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Very durable and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Very durable and heavy duty. Easily lights the natural lump charcoal in just a couple minutes without fumes, especially since you can't (shouldn't) using lighter fluid in a ceramic cooker (Green Egg, Kamado Joe, etc.), so this is a fantastic option.
customer_reviews.author: GB3

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance, 2 Year Longevity
customer_reviews.text: I am on my third Looft Lighter. It is the quickest, easiest way to light lump charcoal on a kamado grill. The melting tip mentioned in some reviews results from improper usage. If you follow the directions, and remove the lighter from direct contact as soon as the charcoal sparks, this issue will not occur. Sadly it will only last two years with use 3-4 times per week, so assume you will be able to light your grill about 400 times before it stops working. Still, to me it's worth it because of the quicker lighting time and you will spend just as much using fire starters.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey E Bullen

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but wish it were a tad bit faster
customer_reviews.text: I really like it and it works as advertised. I just wish it would heat up my lump charcoal a little faster. Probably takes me 5 minutes to start two areas and if cooking steak I get 4 areas burning, so that takes about 10 minutes. I know what you're thinking... 10 minutes dude, really? All I'm saying is that they'll probably release a faster, hotter version in a few years and I just wish I had that one now :)
customer_reviews.author: Broo77777

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift, didn’t think I’d like it. Didn’t have any fire starter pieces for my Kamado Joe, so I got this out to see what it would do. I was impressed. It got my coals going in no time. I still like using the pieces that Joe sells, but this moves a little tiny fire to a perfect white hot, ready to go fire in about two minutes! I’d recommend it for that guy you can’t think of what to get. Get him or her to try it, then sit back and enjoy the compliments.😜😎
customer_reviews.author: PMulvey

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had two. Works great, but doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: I just burnt up my second one of these. The motor always does the same thing when it goes out. It accelerates at a ridiculous rate and then burns up rendering it useless. I love it, but sadly it doesn’t last. I average about 6 months on each one. I never leave mine out in the weather either and always bring it inside. Keep lighter fluid on standby. You’ll need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jman

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected at all. It does not ignite coals as fast as claimed. Rather disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Dale Ross

customer_reviews.title: This Thing is Awesome- Must have if you love to grill-
customer_reviews.text: If you love to grill with real charcoal or lump coal charcoal, this is a must have. I have a Big Green Egg- this lighter is like a high powered blow dryer that heats your lump coal/charcoal to a bright orange burn in 1-2 minutes. Cuts grill prep time in a big way. It's simple and it just works. I had used the little lighter squares for years or electric igniters. This is MUCH better. I highly recommend this if you love to grill.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Read quite a bit about these lighters. They use hot air to light lump charcoal in your grill. They work fine, but are actually slower overall than the wax starters made by Weber. I still use this because it was expensive, but use the wax starters when I’m in a hurry to get the grill going.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Potter

customer_reviews.title: Greatly reduces time to start charcoal
customer_reviews.text: I use only lump charcoal: either Royal Oak or Wicked Good. Wicked Good is dense and tough to light--but not tough for the Looftlighter. I can get either brand going in just a few minutes with the Looftlighter. The Looftlighter has changed my life!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H. Cormen

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY FOR ANY GRILLER!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says it does! I've only had the pleasure of using it a few times, but every time it's performed amazingly! So long lighter fluid, so long, long process charcoal lighting. I look forward to showing off in front of friends and family with this AWESOME product! We grill all the time and this tool will make things sooo much easier!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Fast Coal Lighting
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for the green egg. It is amazing! It only takes a few minutes to light the coals. If you have a grill with charcoal or a green egg, this is a must!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail E

customer_reviews.title: Game changer. That's what this is.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my big green egg... and I will NEVER be purchasing any block fire starters again. In not buying just a few packages of the standard blocks, this thing pays for itself- that doesn't even factor in the amount of time I've saved waiting for the egg to heat up! This thing is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Clerical Coach

customer_reviews.title: Griller Delight
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for the ultimate griller at heart. This lighter is easy to use and worth the value. A novice or master griller would love this as a gift. My husband has purchased 2 of these, gifting one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Beth and Chad Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great Father’s Day present!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! He no longer has to buy lighter fluid so the taste isn’t in our food! Takes almost a minute and a half to get the coals completely going!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Shore

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Super legit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I am a chef and a bbq enthusiast. This is better than a chimney, lighter fluid, kindling whatever. Looflighter is the best way to light a fire. Awesone
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great grill/fireplace lighter!
customer_reviews.text: This fire starter is expensive, but very well made. It is a substantial product. I have a Green Egg and I can have the lump coal completely started and ready to cook in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Helton Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Best Fire Starter Ever...Ideal for BGE Owners
customer_reviews.text: I grill 2 - 3 times per week on my Big Green Egg, and I couldn't imagine going back to any other fire starting method. With the Looftlighter I can go from charcoal to a roaring fire in 2 - 3 minutes...or a smaller area of glowing coals in about 60 seconds. It is quick, clean and controllable. Two notes: read the instructions...the unit gets REALLY hot, and I actually partially melted the aluminum shield by sticking it too deep in the coals (okay, I'm a guy and I didn't read the instructions). Also, I would not store this outdoors...I keep mine in the garage to keep it out of the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Z

customer_reviews.title: It works perfect but it is a burn/fire hazard shortly after use ...
customer_reviews.text: CharGriller guy here, using Fogo charcoals. It works perfect but it is a burn/fire hazard shortly after use and I found a solution for it. Went to AutoZone and got 2.5" internal diameter rezonator pipe and giant clamps (they had them behind the counter only at my store), mounted the rezonator under the side shelf. Now I just shove the Looftlighter into it after use and no more worries, helps cooling too. What a great device, no more extra carcinogens with the yucky starter fluid.
customer_reviews.author: EV4Life

customer_reviews.title: Second time to buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Looftlighter that I have had for several years. I went back with the same product because I think it is a great product. It does its job quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product with terrible choice in metal
customer_reviews.text: The housing (?aluminum) melted in just 2 uses. See picture. Why not use a metal with a higher melting point? Obviously this thing is going to be in contact with very high temperatures. What were you thinking? Have no choice but to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Richlich

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I lived without this... Makes it so much faster to get charcoal going and cooking. Well worth the price and it really feels like a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kafka

customer_reviews.title: Great invention!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome and works wonderfully. I read the directions and watched the YouTube video so I would use it correctly. The first time that I used it, I was thrilled with the results. No more chimney starter! No more long waits for the coals to get hot. I used it to start coconut shell charcoal and it worked like a charm. I used it in a couple of places on the coals and was ready to start grilling in about 10-15 minutes. What a fabulous invention. Worth the cost, and can't wait to use it over and over.
customer_reviews.author: The Baroque Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!  How did I not have one of these before !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this lighter ! Wife bought me a Kamado Joe as a gift . So after reading I saw this was recommended. Sooo much better that traditional light fluid or a starter chimney. How did I not have one of these before !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy YatesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my brother-in-law. Thank God I pulled it out to test it because it stopped working 30 seconds after I turned it on. I let it sit for a little while thinking it would come back on but it never did. It shot a spark and shut off. I returned it and got a refund. Highly recommend not getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lytton

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I have a green egg and I would consider this product a must. I have used a gas grill for years until recently so I am kind of spoiled about heating the grill quickly and cooking. I tuck a few of the stick fire starter things in the coal as well. If you don't want to sit around for 2 hours waiting for your grill to heat then get this.
customer_reviews.author: Dan McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Multitasker, Not Just for Charcoal
customer_reviews.text: I have used my Looftlighter many times, but never for its intended purpose of lighting charcoal. It works great in the kitchen any time you need controlled, intense heat. I find it easier to control than a torch or broiler for many applications. I hang it on my pot rack for easy access and use it at least a couple of times a week. I've used mine to toast buns, roast peppers, and melt cheese. I use it to brown the outsides of meats that I have cooked sous vide. It will even caramelize sugar on creme brulee.
customer_reviews.author: James Ryan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 6 months but immediately expressed a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Update: I went to the manufacturer web site and registered the issue and they immediately expressed me a new one. So I’m revising my rating. Stopped working after less than 6 months. Was great up until then but it’s not supposed to be disposable. Only offer a 30 day return policy, run away. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Did not last too long!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great, too bad it only lasted 3 months. It will not turn on now. I registered my product. Tried to contact Looftlighter via e-mail they did not respond to my e-mail. Cannot recomend this product, poor customer service. I really liked it when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: Socrates

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This electric fire starter works great. I've used it several times and I'm impressed with the workmanship of the product and the ease that it gets my charcoals going. I will definitely buy it again, but hopefully not for a few years
customer_reviews.author: Louis Longoria

customer_reviews.title: It works well.
customer_reviews.text: Built well, gets hot fast, but the power button has to be depressed By user to keep it on. Give me a on / off switch. not something I have to stand there and hold on.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great but the end of the outer casing was slightly damaged. Looked like it had been dropped on concrete. Didn't think it would impact the use of the product but when starting the fire in my BGE it can start to melt the outer casing where the damage was at. Afraid the long term life may be limited but when it wears out I will buy another. Takes me 3 min to get the BGE going with this. Would be 5 starts if mine was not damaged, should have returned but couldn't wait to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best Fire Starting Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is product is probably one of my best buys ever for bbq. It lights fire withing a minute and produces a great a mount of heat. I use it with my green egg for charcoal and in my normal fire pit. Works great for both.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Looftlighter
customer_reviews.text: This was our second lighter. The first one died after about 5 years but it was used A LOT. If it wasn't a great product we wouldn't have bought the same one as a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: this is awesme
customer_reviews.text: this may be my best purchase ever... lights charcoal quick and easy and because it's so precise in the lighting you get a more even and longer burn.
customer_reviews.author: RWB56

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Alton Brown for showing this off!
customer_reviews.text: If Alton Brown uses it then you know it's a must have tool. I was sick of using my chimney starter, paper, and olive oil to start up my grill. With this monster all it takes is about 5 - 8 mins and my grill is a inferno.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Macasevich

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great. It’s not as fast as a mapp torch ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. It’s not as fast as a mapp torch but a mapp torch doesn’t have a fan either. It’s definitely a great way to light your charcoal. I’ve been using it for a few months now and I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Makes charcoal cooking a delight
customer_reviews.text: Love IT! Fastest I’ve ever started a grill. Might have a little longer from first time using, but otherwise worked as shown in video and manual.
customer_reviews.author: CoronersDisciple

customer_reviews.title: hot time
customer_reviews.text: this is the second one I've bought because i'm very impressed with it. unlike other such tools, this does not have a blow only position, so i'm hoping that means this simple on/off toggle is more durable. in just a few minutes you can create a flat base of hot charcoal onto which you can pile fresh ones. the hot ones will ignite the ones piled on top, so the total elapsed time is less than a chimney starter, and both starters eschew pretty nasty chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Hon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Other one we had for a few years just quit working. We use for our Big Green Egg
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Wicks

customer_reviews.title: Lights charcoal fast with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The looftlighter works great starting the lump charcoal in my big green egg. My first one stopped working after roughly 6 months of use, but the looftlighter customer service was excellent! They honored their 2 yr warranty and sent me a new one without even having to send my old one back. Great product and service!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect charcole starter.
customer_reviews.text: A close friend recommended this product as a must have. I bought on line and LOVE IT! No more fire starter pieces. Easy to use and quick. Push the start switch and hold tip to charcoal until you see sparks then pull away and let the forced air fan the fire. This thing works. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: William Hall

customer_reviews.title: Zero Hassle
customer_reviews.text: The Looftlighter is heavier duty than anticipated and has a great, long cord for zero hassle. Holding the button seems tiresome after about a minute, so it would be great if there were some type of lock on it. However, I can see where that would raise safety concerns. The Looftlighter creates a deeper fire than your average fire starter that sits on top of your coals.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Starter
customer_reviews.text: Great starter i use with my BGE. I love how quick it is. It seems inconvenient to have to hold the button when you start but i quickly realized this helps the user prevent allowing the device to “burn up” which is what happened to my previous device.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor P Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, simple and fast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic, don’t know why I waited so long to get it. Fast, easy and no handling the greasy fire starters
customer_reviews.author: Smlbound

customer_reviews.title: I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it promised to do, light my Kamado Joe in a minute. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: pnaplace

customer_reviews.title: Looflighter... Great idea, but doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this with high hopes of lighting my Weber chimney full of charcoal without having to use balled up paper. Guess what... paper works much better and much faster. This thing takes f o r e v e r !. Save your money, go to Publix and get the weekly advertisement papers. I found that balling up 8 of them and inserting under the chimney lights the coals perfectly... and quickly. Did I mention that they are also FREE? I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: It lights the big green egg in about 1.5 min. BUT
customer_reviews.text: The body is made of preferred aluminum, and the tip melts off quite easily . The inner heater is SS and has a much higher melt point temp. It hasn’t failed ( after 3 uses ) yet, but it seems doomed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire it up..
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from Amazon Warehouse and I love it.
